author: trent_vanepps
content: thanks! when would you say this was last modified?

author: trent_vanepps
content: like, Homestead?

author: .vbuterin
content: It says 2019 but I think the modifications were tiny since around 2016

author: trent_vanepps
content:
resource pricing has always been unclear to me, maybe because it's not really an ongoing area of consistent research, so there aren't "up-to-date" resources for it

any idea where to find anything on the new methodolody?

author: .vbuterin
content: There are various scattered writings

author: .vbuterin
content: So I think it depends which subproblem you are interested in

author: .vbuterin
content: There are basically two sub-problems

author: trent_vanepps
content: gotcha

author: .vbuterin
content:
1. How to price computing vs bandwidth vs storage
2. How to determine the computation time of various opcodes/precompiles, so we can give all the different types of computing the same ratio of price-to-effort

author: .vbuterin
content: (1) is more of a "deep thinking" problem, (2) is more of an empirical/coding/benchmarking problem

author: chfast
content: Why `NEW_MAX_REFUND_QUOTIENT` not `MAX_REFUND_QUOTIENT`?

author: .vbuterin
content: Because the current `MAX_REFUND_QUOTIENT` is 2 (it's not documented as a constant but it arguably is)

author: .vbuterin
content: But I'm happy with just calling it `MAX_REFUND_QUOTIENT` too

author: chfast
content: I believe in many other EIPs is rather "change the constant `MAX_REFUND_QUOTIENT` from 2 to 5". I prefer doing it this way (in this case you would need also to introduce the constant name). But not a blocker to me.

author: .vbuterin
content: I'm happy with any rewording; if someone wants to go edit it to something better I don't oppose
